With a 70k income, you’re well-positioned to afford a home in Alabama. 
You could target properties between $210k and $280k, depending on your down payment and other expenses. 
In Columbus, where the median home price is around $310,000, you’ll have a variety of options. 
Other cities like Cleveland and Dayton may offer even more affordability, with prices closer to $200,000 to $250,000. 
Alabama's property tax rate averages 1.41%, potentially adding about $5,000 annually on a $210k home. 
Thanks to a cost of living 12% below the national average, your salary can support comfortable homeownership across much of the state.
